title: Centrist Senate Democrats Signal Opposition to Biden Banking Nominee; Concern conveyed in telephone call with committee chairman, likely scuttling Saule Omarova's chances of confirmation
text:
The conversation, reported earlier by Axios, came after Messrs. Warner and Tester challenged Ms. Omarova at a Nov. 18 hearing over her past writing and thinking on banking oversight. The Cornell University law professor is Mr. Biden's pick to head the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, which oversees large national banks such as JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Bank of America Corp.

Eliza Collins contributed to this article.

Write to Andrew Ackerman at andrew.ackerman@wsj.com

Centrist Senate Democrats Signal Opposition to Biden Banking Nominee
